Description: A unique identifier assigned to specimens collected from study participants. For multi-specimen data files provide all IDs in a comma-separated list.

An alternate identifier for a sample. With some assays there can be default or alternate sample identifiers entered into the data collection software. If you will be uploading data collected with an alternate identifier please provide that here. In some cases, the ARK BDM team will use this field to capture original but out-dated identifiers for samples.

Biospecimen status before sample is processed into a scRNA-seq library. Several scRNA-seq technologies support a variety of sample processing methods which can introduces sources of technical variation.
Valid Values: FFPE tissue, PFA-fixed tissue, cell or tissue lysate, cell suspension, flow-sorted cells, fresh tissue, frozen tissue, nuclei suspension, supernatant

Description: Unique identifier assigned to each study participant. For multi-specimen data files provide all IDs in a comma-separated list.
A sub-level attribute of `program` specifying a research initiative working to investigate particular hypotheses.
Valid Values: AIM for RA, ELLIPSS, LOCKIT, RA, SLE, STAMP, V-CoRT

Description: Please use this attribute to captured pertinent details not otherwise captured. This is an unstructured text entry, please be concise.
A label indicating the biological material collected for experimentation and data collection. Where applicable, provide all types in a comma-separated list.
Valid Values: PBMCs, cell line, fibroblast-like synoviocyte, kidney biopsy, none, plasma, primary cell culture, saliva, salivary gland, serum, skin biopsy, skin swab, stool, suction blister cells, suction blister fluid, synovial fluid, synovial tissue, total leukocytes, urine, uvea, whole blood

Description: A high-level attribute for grouping attributes into templates.
Name of the funding program that supported the generation of data and associated files
Valid Values: AMP AIM, AMP RA/SLE, Community Contribution

Description: The biospecimenID associated with the originating biospecimen for derived or child biospecimens.
The cell type name from Cell Ontology for the corresponding CL identifier.
User-defined label of a cell type. Contributors are provided this option to use preferred or custom cell type labels that may vary from options and standards set by Cell Ontology.
Cell Ontology CL identifier that best describes a biopsecimen used to generate data, e.g., CL:0000084 for T cell.
A description of the marker gating strategy used to derive the population cells with FACS.
A label indicating the biological source material from which a primary cell culture was derived.
Valid Values: PBMCs, kidney, pannus-derived dermis, pannus-derived epidermis, salivary gland, synovial tissue, total leukocytes, urine, uvea, whole blood

Description: A standardized, semi-quantitative measure of stromal cell density of synovial specimen. This is one of three measures used to derive the Krenn Synovitis Score (KSS) which is a histological scoring system used to quantify inflammation in synovial tissue biopsies, particularly in the context of inflammatory arthritis like rheumatoid arthritis. If value unknown, enter '-1'.

The Krenn Synovitis Score (KSS) is a histological scoring system used to quantify inflammation in synovial tissue biopsies, particularly in the context of inflammatory arthritis like rheumatoid arthritis. If value unknown, use '-1'.
The anatomical site, i.e., location on or within the body, from which the biospecimen was collected. This attribute is required depending on the value selected for biospecimenType.
Valid Values: left 2nd MCP joint, left ankle joint, left hip joint, left knee joint, left wrist joint, other site, right 1st MTP joint, right 2nd MCP joint, right 2nd MTP joint, right 3rd MCP joint, right ankle joint, right hip joint, right knee joint, right wrist joint, unknown

Description: A standardized, semi-quantitative measure of the degree of hyperplasia/enlargement of the synovial lining layer of synovial specimen. This is one of three measures used to derive the Krenn Synovitis Score (KSS) which is a histological scoring system used to quantify inflammation in synovial tissue biopsies, particularly in the context of inflammatory arthritis like rheumatoid arthritis. If value unknown, use '-1'.

A standardized, semi-quantitative measure of the degree of inflammatory infiltrate in synovial specimen. This is one of three measures used to derive the Krenn Synovitis Score (KSS) which is a histological scoring system used to quantify inflammation in synovial tissue biopsies, particularly in the context of inflammatory arthritis like rheumatoid arthritis. If value unknown, enter '-1'.
Classification of procedure for synovial tissue collection.
Disease manifestation status of skin biospecimen.
Valid Values: healthy control, lesional, lesional proximal, non-lesional

Description: Classification of saliva collection procedure. This is a conditionally dependent attribute triggered for saliva `biospecimenType`.
Ordinal ID distinguishing different patient visits.
